ygData.subject: Re: Something...
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, quite true.  I also heard of a necromancer who hunt too many decaying skeletons that his guild master refused to teach him skills. I myself was hunting
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, quite true. I also heard of a necromancer who hunt too many decaying
skeletons that his guild master refused to teach him skills.

I myself was hunting emerald drakes with a group of guys 2 weeks ago and
one of them is a wood-elf cleric or something like tat. He refuse to
attack emerald drakes coz he got a faction msg after he kill one. In the
end we went for goblin camps instead.

I think for those dungeon creatures, you have to try them out. Those which
will give u faction msg (note: dun be over-sensitive wil faction msg, u
will get them somehow or another, most importantly is those msg related to
ya guild), better stop attacking them.

Mondain

On Monday, June 14, 1999 2:06 PM, Sereph [SMTP:garford@...]
wrote:
> Playing evil characters hurt in the long run, since many dungeons are
evil in
> nature and some creatures in them, when killed can lower the fraction
rating of
> your own city!!!
>
> A friend of mine had a Dark Elf rogue that was turn away by his guild
master,
> and had no way to increase his fraction back.
>
> So aim before you kill. A creature might increase fraction with the city
you
> are going into, but might harm that of your own guild.
>
> LKW wrote:
>
> > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> >
> > Yep, no more agnostic for necro. This is becoz too many pple wanna get
the
> > goodies from TSK or Necro but yet wanna enjoy good faction after
killing
> > hundreds of orcs by selecting agnostic (coz it help in improving ya
> > faction). Afterall evil classes are made more powerful to compensate
their
> > faction hit.
> >
> > Dark Elf alone shld be quite easy to improve faction - Kenven once did
it
> > b4 as a DE warrior, by killing many orcs and he can enter Freeport at
lvl 9
> > I think (but some npc merchants at commonlands still refuse to do biz
with
> > him). But DEN is more evil, so u will need more time to gain good
faction.
> >
> > Why not we create a Dark Elves/Trolls evil team, forget abt the good
> > faction thingy and bash the good races city, hehe. I read some high
lvl
> > dark elf wizards/shadow knights actually attack Freeport guards in
other
> > servers (no need to find monsters to hunt, lol), sound kewl!
> >
> > Btw, Leshrec also got a DEN in Prexus server.
> >
> > Mondain
> >
> > On Monday, June 14, 1999 9:07 AM, Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy
> > [SMTP:sccheng@...] wrote:
> > > ok... im not sure if its true... ive read up article from either
Everlore
> > or EQVault... or EQ Stratics... in one of the necro guides... it
mentioned
> > no able to choose agnostic fer Dark Elves anymore... wonder if its
true...
> > >
> > > Fred aka SilverHand.

> > > hi all,
> > > it seems that quite abit had happened over the pass weekend when
i
> > wasnt around... the party got formed... n stuff like that... n ive
readup

> > necromancer has spells that spread over a pretty wide range... from
> > summoning... to direct damage... to healing... that no one spellcasting
> > class can provide... however this is with the drawback of faction....
so i
> > guess my first char in EQ will most likely be a Necromancer... but i
havent
> > decide to make a Erudite or Dark Elf Necro ... most likely Dark Elf...
but
> > i think i need to do more research on faction n stuff like that....
maybe
> > some of u guys can help me out here... esp Leshrec...
> > > 1. is it that bad that a Dark Elf Necro is KOS in other
towns/cities?

can

this

BTW...

guys...

> > >
> > > Also, not sure about Trade Skills... anyone has any advice fer

char

> > >
> > > cheers,
> > > Fred
